news_header: A study shows that electric fans do not significantly cool older adults during extreme heat.
news_text: Research published in the Journal of the American Medical Association indicates that electric fans are ineffective in reducing core body temperatures in older adults during extreme heat conditions. A study involving 18 participants aged 65 to 72 found no significant changes in core temperature or thermal comfort when using fans, especially at ambient temperatures above 33°C (91°F). The study highlights the risks older adults face during heat waves, particularly when lacking air conditioning, and suggests that traditional fan use may not provide the expected relief.
